Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; slightly concave offset rim; interior glazed black (much worn on rim); exterior: narrow black line at top of rim; lip and handle zone reserved with line between; glazed below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as belonging to a Type 9B South Ionian cup with everted rim. These cups closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus, the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
There is a modern graffiti on the inside identifying it as being from the area of the temenos of Hera.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 67, no. 844, pl. XXII, no. 844)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 691, no. 493)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 245)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.659) (Phase 3)
